article_title: Houston agencies, organizations receive ACA enrollment grants
article_text:
Houston agencies, organizations receive ACA enrollment grants

Three Houston-based agencies and organizations are among seven statewide to split nearly $10 million in federal grant funding to help the uninsured sign up for health insurance when the enrollment period resumes later this year.

article_metadata.description: According to information released by the federal health care officials, Houston's Health and Human Services Department will use its $1.8 million award to continue a program it launched last year, establishing a call center and website to direct people where they could get health insurance enrollment assistance.  Change Happens, a nonprofit service provider, has been awarded $1,115,000 to work with the Houston area's Children's Books on Wheels and the Children's Center, the Alliance for Multicultural Community Services, Dia de la Mujer Latina and the Lesbian Health Initiative of Houston to hold health insurance enrollment, education and outreach activities.  The Light and Salt Association, a nonprofit organization, has been awarded $295,180 to reach Asian-Americans with outreach and in-person enrollment assistance using different Asian languages to increase their success to get people signed up for coverage.  "In-person assistance from groups like the seven organizations in Texas that will be acting as navigators is a vital part of making sure uninsured Texans can successfully get their health insurance questions answered to secure the coverage they need," Mimi Garcia, Texas State Director of Enroll America, a nonprofit health care enrollment coalition, said in a written statement.
article_metadata.author.name: By Lora Hines
